alert.note: Alert for Menifee; Montgomery; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 6:52PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Powell, southeastern Montgomery and western Menifee Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 652 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cornwell, or near Frenchburg, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rothwell and Fagan around 705 PM EDT. Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest and Haystack around 710 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Tabor, Sudith and Frenchburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
